Rumored to be a spy, an atheist, and â€œwildâ€; some even thought he faked his death.
Was stabbed to death in a bar fight, widely believed to be a cover-up for espionage or debt.
Boozy and reckless, he borrowed money and plotlines, then disappeared to dodge enemies.
People still debate if he wrote some of Shakespeareâ€™s early works.

Led the â€œWar of the Theatres,â€ mocking rivals like Dekker and Marston on stage and off.

Victim of Marloweâ€™s shade, even posthumously.
Snobs at court adored his florid prose, but rivals like Dekker mocked it as â€œold junk.â€
Never made it as Master of the Revels, despite years of scheming.
Rumored to start cliques at court and pit other playwrights against each other.

Rumored to spread damaging gossip about rivals just for sport.
Accused of bedding a patronâ€™s wife for a place to stay during hard times.
Known for plagiarizing plot concepts, then trash-talking the originals.
Lifelong drinker, not above a sly jab at Greene or Lyly in public.

Fashionista: rumor had it he spent more on ruffs than on quills.

Rivals accused him of being morbidly obsessed with taboo, just for shock value.
Some believed he wrote anonymous hate mail to undermine rivalsâ€™ reputations.

Left a prank â€œtreasure mapâ€ in his will to annoy surviving foes.

Quiet, but wildly jealous. He called Massinger a â€œhackâ€ behind closed doors.
Had a secret circle of â€œfavoritesâ€ and was known for petty backstage gossip.
Parodied rivalsâ€™ hairlines in his plays; literal shade.
Gossiped about as â€œtwo-facedâ€ by former co-authors.
Claimed plagiarism when his own work was censored; not above slandering rivals in paratexts.

Loved slipping sly jabs at fellow dramatistsâ€™ stage tics into his scripts.
Was infamous for holding grudges over supposed literary thefts.

Was fond of trash-talking his competitors at London taverns.
Nicknamed â€œthe Magpieâ€ for repeating any secret he overheard.
At various points claimed to be an agent for the king, rivals rolled their eyes.

Said his workroom was robbed by rivals seeking plot spoilers.

Deep in debt, rumored to gamble away collaboratorsâ€™ fees.
